page.title: 04Tideswell Village
page.content: Tideswell is about 330 metres above sea level.The weather is very cold and damp in winter,but in summer it can be warm,the temperature reaching 70 degrees celcius. There are{four churches and chapels in Tideswell:the Catholic Chapel,the Methodist Chapel,the United Reformed Chapel and the Church of England.In the Parish Churchyard William Newton, the Minstrel of the Peak (who died 1830) is buried.The church is very large and has a very high tower.It is often called the{Cathedral of the {Peak. Most houses are built of limestone with gritstone lintels etc.They are generally well kept. There is a reasonable amount of open space but there are not many trees in the village.
